Contradict fact: The claim does not contradict any factual information.
Exaggerate: The claim does not contain any exaggerated statements.
Understate: The claim does not understate any information.
Falters at times: The claim does not falter at any point.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the New York Times contradicted their previous report about wiretapping.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the New York Times contradicted their own report without providing evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the difference in reporting between the two articles.
